name: Gilbertese

sentences: E nooria te aine te aomata
The man saw the woman
E kunea te uaa te aine
The woman found the fruit
E taraa te nii te nati
The child looked at the coconut tree
E kamanoa te nati te aomata
The man protected the child
E nooria te uee te aomata
The man saw the flower
E kunea te aomata te aine
The woman found the man
E nooria te uaa te uee
The flower saw the fruit
A na noori-a te nii taian aine
The women will see the coconut tree
E kune-a te nii te aine
The woman found the coconut tree
E na tara-a te uee te nati
The child will look at the flower
A tara-i taian aomata taian nati
The children looked at the men
E na kune-a te uee te aomata
The man will find the flower
A kune-i taian uee taian aomata
The men found the flowers

The man saw the fruit
A na kunei taian uee taian aine
The women will find the flowers
A na kunea te uee taian aomata
The men will find the flower
E na noorii taian uee te aine

The women found the flowers
A na kunea te uaa taian aine
The women will find the fruit
E noorii taian uaa te aomata.
The man saw the fruits.
A kunea te uaa taian aomata.
The men found the fruit.
E na nooria te uee te aine.
The woman will see the flower.
E kunea te uaa te aine.
The woman found the fruit.
A taraa te uaa taian nati.
The children looked at the fruit.
E na kamanoi taian uee te nati.
The child will protect the flowers.
A na tarai taian nii taian aomata.
The men will look at the coconut trees.
E kamanoa te nii te aine.
The woman protected the coconut tree.

note: The language is an Austronesian languagespoken mainly in Kiribati, with 120,000 native speakers.
